3: Wait...!
Evan! Get back here!
He likely didn't catch you. Human hearing isn't as good as Constructs. Besides, he's probably in the forest by now.
Yeah, a child can't possibly outrun a Construct.
Hey! Stop! What are you doing!
What are you planning on doing at the Forest Guard's settlement?
...We're not enemies.
Did you see a child go by?
A child? What child?
I'll take that as a no.
I don't know what you're going on about. All I know is that you have not stated your purpose for coming here.
We're looking for the Forest Guards. Staessen wants them to return to the banquet.
...Why does Staessen need the Forest Guards?
The guard looks at you and picks up the radio receiver skeptically, but his harpoon still remains firmly pointed at you.
Lighthouse, Lighthouse. This is Northwest #3. Please put the captain online.
Yes, it's me. I heard these Babylonians say...
Alright, understood.
The guard puts down the radio, and places his harpoon on the pile of firewood.
Get going. Staessen's cool with it.
But stay alert. Bionic numbers may be thinning, but they are still wandering around out there.
